threats.Description: If account-level public access blocks are not enabled or incorrectly configured (BlockPublicAcls, BlockPublicPolicy, IgnorePublicAcls, RestrictPublicBuckets), newly created buckets could expose data publicly by default.
threats.Mitigation: Enable and enforce S3 account-level public access blocks to prevent unintended public exposures for all buckets.

threats.Source: Malicious or Unprivileged Users Exploiting ACLs
threats.Description: Bucket ACLs can unintentionally grant read/write permissions if configured improperly, allowing attackers or unauthorized users to list or modify data.
threats.Mitigation: Prohibit or limit ACL usage (e.g., S3_BUCKET_ACL_PROHIBITED), relying on bucket policies and IAM for access control.

threats.Description: Disabling default object lock increases the risk of permanent data loss from overwrites or deletions before they can be reversed.
threats.Mitigation: Enable default bucket lock (S3_BUCKET_DEFAULT_LOCK_ENABLED) to protect against unintended deletions and ensure immutability.

threats.Threat Name: Public Bucket Access at Bucket Level
threats.Description: If a bucket allows public access at the bucket level, sensitive data may be exposed to anyone online, posing a high risk of data leakage.
threats.Mitigation: Block public bucket policies (S3_BUCKET_LEVEL_PUBLIC_ACCESS_PROHIBITED) and rely on private policies with least-privilege configurations.

threats.Description: Buckets without logging enabled provide no detailed records of read/write actions, delaying detection of suspicious behavior and complicating investigations.
threats.Mitigation: Enable server access logging (S3_BUCKET_LOGGING_ENABLED) and configure logs to be stored securely for auditing and compliance.

threats.Description: Allowing public read access can expose sensitive bucket objects to any internet user, leading to potential data leaks.
threats.Mitigation: Prohibit public read access (S3_BUCKET_PUBLIC_READ_PROHIBITED) by using block public access settings, bucket policies, or ACL rules.

threats.Source: Malicious or Anonymous Actors Uploading/Modifying Data
threats.Description: A bucket permitting public writes allows attackers to upload malicious content or overwrite legitimate data, potentially leading to sabotage or malicious hosting.
threats.Mitigation: Enable bucket policies or ACLs that prohibit public writes (S3_BUCKET_PUBLIC_WRITE_PROHIBITED).

threats.Description: Without cross-region replication, a regional disaster or corruption event could lead to data loss and disrupted operations.
threats.Mitigation: Enable cross-region replication (S3_BUCKET_REPLICATION_ENABLED) for critical data to maintain copies in different regions.

threats.Source: Internal Malicious Actors or Excessive Privileges
threats.Target: Amazon S3 Bucket Policies and Configurations
threats.Description: Certain sensitive S3 actions (e.g., DeleteBucketPolicy, PutBucketAcl) can compromise security if misused by unauthorized individuals.
threats.Mitigation: Prohibit blacklisted actions (S3_BUCKET_BLACKLISTED_ACTIONS_PROHIBITED) via IAM or bucket policies to prevent unauthorized execution.

threats.Description: Allowing HTTP connections can leak or corrupt data in transit, exposing object content or credentials.
threats.Mitigation: Enforce HTTPS-only traffic (S3_BUCKET_SSL_REQUESTS_ONLY) to safeguard data and requests from interception or tampering.

threats.Description: Without versioning, older versions of objects are overwritten or removed, making it impossible to restore data changes or undo deletions.
threats.Mitigation: Enable bucket versioning (S3_BUCKET_VERSIONING_ENABLED) to preserve object history and recover from accidental overwrites.

threats.Threat Name: Unencrypted Bucket or Default Encryption Disabled
threats.Source: Anyone with Physical or Administrative Access to Underlying Storage
threats.Description: Storing data unencrypted at rest can expose sensitive information if the storage layer is compromised or incorrectly accessed.
threats.Mitigation: Require default encryption (S3_DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION_KMS or SSE-S3) to ensure all objects are encrypted at rest by default.

threats.Description: Without event notifications, changes in bucket contents go untracked, delaying detection of malicious uploads or data deletions.
threats.Mitigation: Enable and configure S3 event notifications (S3_EVENT_NOTIFICATIONS_ENABLED) to monitor object-level operations in real time.

threats.Description: Buckets storing multiple versions of objects without a lifecycle policy may face high storage costs and accidental use of outdated data.
threats.Mitigation: Enable and enforce version lifecycle policies (S3_VERSION_LIFECYCLE_POLICY_CHECK) to automatically manage or expire older object versions.
